alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 8:27PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Winnebago, eastern Waushara, southeastern Waupaca and Outagamie Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 827 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Waupaca to near Fremont to near Wautoma. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fremont around 830 PM CDT. Lake Poygan around 835 PM CDT. New London around 840 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Oshkosh, Menasha, Black Creek, Rush Lake, Appleton, Little Chute, Kimberly, Northern Lake Winnebago and Kaukauna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Wisconsin.
